body_html:
Why is it okay to allow user to call this method with parameter that will result in no effect?

Returning None does not mean resulting in no effect. Calling an op usually has an effect.

wouldn't it be possible to automatically call for its .values() in the Session.run() instead of returning a None?

It won't be possible because not every op has output values.
body_text:
Why is it okay to allow user to call this method with parameter that will result in no effect?

Returning None does not mean resulting in no effect. Calling an op usually has an effect.

wouldn't it be possible to automatically call for its .values() in the Session.run() instead of returning a None?

It won't be possible because not every op has output values.
body:
> Why is it okay to allow user to call this method with parameter that will result in no effect?

Returning `None` does not mean resulting in no effect. Calling an op usually has an effect.

> wouldn't it be possible to automatically call for its .values() in the Session.run() instead of returning a None?

It won't be possible because not every op has output values.
